newsitem.title: UK: UK Jan car registrations rise 7.8 pct to 206,784.
newsitem.headline: UK Jan car registrations rise 7.8 pct to 206,784.

text.p: New car registrations in Britain rose by 7.8 percent in January to 206,784 from 191,761 in the same year-ago month, the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders Ltd (SMMT) said on Thursday.
The SMMT said that within these figures private registrations rose by 7.6 percent while business registrations rose by 27.2 percent and fleet registrations by 5.2 perent.
"The year has started on a positive note," SMMT chief executive Ernie Thompson said in a statement.
In December 1996 registrations rose by 9.23 percent on the month to give a 4.12 percent rise for the whole of last year.

Ford Motor Co continued to occupy the top-selling slots with registrations of its Mondeo, Escort and Fiesta models aggregating about 36,000 cars. The group's total sales fell, however, to 40,451 from 41,837 in the same 1996 month and its market share slipped to 19.56 percent from 21.82 percent.
Vauxhall, part of General Motors Corp, had the next three slots and its market share rose marginally to 14.64 percent from 14.58 percent.
